key_title: Key to the species of Dysphania

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Chenopodiaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Chenopodiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Walsh, N.G. (1996). Chenopodiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Tepals 5, not hooded or inflated towards the apex
Tepals 3, often hooded and inflated towards the apex in fruit
Flowers in sessile axillary clusters, not exceeding the subtending leaves
Flowers in dense erect, leafless spikes, far exceeding the ephemeral basal leaves; rare annual of far north-west
Tepals of most flowers united to just below apex; stamens 5; seed horizontal to erect
Tepals shortly united at base; stamens 1 or 2; seed erect
Tepals prominently crested by a deeply laciniate, pubescent ridge; plants of north-west only
Tepals rounded, acute or keeled by an entire dorsal ridge
Tepals keeled; seed narrowly flanged; plants of far east only
Tepals rounded dorsally, but often thickening and becoming pale at maturity; seed not flanged; widespread, often weedy species of lowlands and foothills
